intro: Paronychia kurdica subsp. kurdica, commonly known as the Kurdish sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape, with small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in racemes. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent stems and hairy foliage. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
